Description: Green jasper seal-stone. Conical with a hole near the tapering top for suspension on string as a pendant. Flat circular base engraved with design of a four legged animal with tail and two drilled ‘eyes’ viewed in plan (maybe schematic scorpion or turtle?). Small chip near base.
Curator's comments: Animal represented similar to scorpion or turtle hieroglyphs, but not clear.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (PA.05)
